Articles.Content: If you ask me this real time multi player combat will be the death of the fleet battles lol. I want to know hoe you guys are going to shoot each-other down? The missiles are already as inaccurate as can be and even if you try to hit people with a smart missile its like hitting a drunk mouse with another drunk mouse.
@ zekes: yeah, so much easier with the sub assemblies now, I just switched all of my ships to the best one.

If you ask me this real time multi player combat will be the death of the fleet battles lol. I want to know hoe you guys are going to shoot each-other down? The missiles are already as inaccurate as can be and even if you try to hit people with a smart missile its like hitting a drunk mouse with another drunk mouse.

I did a few test runs where I lobbed a fighter at another one and then switched ships and tried to shoot it down, its hard but you can score hits. As for aviodance action, with the missiles moving so much faster than the ships it's going to cost alot of fuel to dodge one...

Edited October 30, 2013 by Mr Tegu

Are we talking planes or ships, because ships may work to an extent but you have to get close to shoot at a target and if the move just slightly you will miss because they don't hit fast enough. Even with smart missiles the fact that your enemy is bobbing an weaving round means that simply flying to target is no longer an option. Also I'd hate to have a crash during combat, its a pain in the @&$.

Planes are just to difficult. Its hard enough to hit a stationary target with the stock missiles and bombs.

If and when they add robotic parts like the mod so you can have turrets then it will be far more effective.
As nice as it would be to have a computer that can handle it, Im going to stick with typical space battles

Fortunately though my PC is five years old, I was able to procure a rather good collection of bits and build a stable machine that can handle gaming for at lest the next six or seven years. If you are at all in the market go on newegg.com and get the parts your self i spent less than a grand operating system and office included. Got everything for a working computer that has triple SLI, and 16 gig of ram. Not the best now but still up to par.

On a side note who wants to have a space battle. I'm waiting for wareagle this weekend but still have yet to battle anyone on his thread

Where is Eons Drift?

It is a tabletop game I created centered around a near future war in sol. the drift refers to using a planet as a slingshot and is a manuver that many take to get to the outer planets faster. Eon is the name of the main capitol colony on mars.
